newsitem.title: USA: Washington attorney general sues teachers' union.
newsitem.headline: Washington attorney general sues teachers' union.

text.p: The state attorney general's office said on Wednesday it sued the Washington Education Association (WEA), alleging violations of the state's campaign finance law.
"This suit seeks to enforce the law and bring WEA into compliance," Washington state Attorney General Christine Gregoire said in a statement.
The Washington Education Association said it would respond in court to the charges.

"WEA has always done its best to follow the law in representing the interests of our members and of public education," Washington Education Association President C.T. Purdom said in a statement. "The sooner this (suit) is resolved, the sooner we'll be able to focus all of our attention on improving public schools and improving the working lives of our 65,000 members."

The attorney general said the teachers' union was charged with failing to correctly report hundreds of thousands of dollars in contributions, "loans" and expenditures that were allegedly used for political activities.
In addition, the suit alleged that the association improperly collected and spent union dues to help finance its political-action committee.
The suit also charged that the association used its community outreach program as a second political-action committee without properly registering it with the Public Disclosure Commission.
According to the attorney general, the association improperly financed and failed to report $233,000 in contributions to campaigns to defeat charter schools and voucher initiatives.
In 1992, voters in Washington state approved Initiative 134, which changed campaign finance disclosure rules.
The initiative prohibits the practice of using mandatory union payroll deductions for political activities without annual, written reauthorization from each union member.
Last December, the Washington Education Association went to Thurston County Superior Court, seeking a judgment that its community outreach program is not a political committee.
The attorney general's lawsuit was filed as a counterclaim to that action.
